example_workflow.Rmd
  
  library(tidyverse)
#> Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 4.3.3
#> Warning: package 'tidyr' was built under R version 4.3.3
#> ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
#> ✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.4
#> ✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
#> ✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
#> ✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
#> ✔ purrr     1.0.2     
#> ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
#> ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
#> ✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
#> ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors
  library(envImport)

  out_dir <- here::here("inst", "out", "ds") # ds for data source

  aoi <- sf::st_read(here::here("inst", "shp", "Bakara_smaller.shp"))
#> Reading layer `Bakara_smaller' from data source 
#>   `H:\dev\nige\packages\envImport\inst\shp\Bakara_smaller.shp' 
#>   using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
#> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 1 field
#> Geometry type: POLYGON
#> Dimension:     XY
#> Bounding box:  xmin: 139.916 ymin: -34.59444 xmax: 140.0051 ymax: -34.50441
#> Geodetic CRS:  GDA94

  aoi_buffer <- aoi %>%
    sf::st_buffer(50000) %>%
    sf::st_transform(crs = 4283) %>%
    sf::st_make_valid()

  gbif_dir <- here::here(out_dir, "gbif")

  gbif_raw <- get_gbif(aoi = aoi_buffer
                       , save_dir = gbif_dir
                       , get_new = FALSE
                       , rgbif::pred_gte("year", 2022)
                       )

  gbif <- make_gbif(gbif_raw
                    , data_map = envImport::data_map
                    )

  tern_dir <- here::here(out_dir, "tern")

  tern_raw <- get_tern(aoi = aoi_buffer
                       , save_dir = tern_dir
                       , get_new = FALSE # while testing
                       , veg.PI = TRUE
                       )

  tern <- make_tern(tern_raw
                    , data_map = data_map
                    )
#> Joining with `by = join_by(site_unique)`
#> Joining with `by = join_by(growth_form)`
#> Joining with `by = join_by(site_unique, standardised_name)`

  bio_all <- unite_data(data_map
                      , get_new = TRUE
                      , out_file = here::here("inst", "out", "ds", "bio_all.parquet")
                      )
#> Joining with `by = join_by(date)`
#> Joining with `by = join_by(date)`
